channel.title: Coat — Config of Annotated Types
channel.description: Recent content on Coat — Config of Annotated Types

item.title: Installation
item.description: Coat consists of two separate jars. The annotation processor to generate the config classes. Only needed at compile time. The runtime package containing the common base class for all generated config classes and the default type converters. Needed at runtime. To use Coat in a maven based project use the following maven coordinates: 1 <!-- Contains the annotation processor. Not needed at runtime. --> 2 <dependency> 3 <groupId>de.poiu.coat</groupId> 4 <artifactId>coat-processor</artifactId> 5 <version>0.

item.title: Prerequisites
item.description: Coat has no runtime dependencies on other libraries. The annotation processor has some dependencies on other libraries (which is why it is recommended to use maven as it resolves those dependencies automatically), but none of them are needed at runtime. Coat can be used with Java 11 or higher.

item.title: Themes' Docs
item.description: These docs consists of two parts: Hugo Compose Themes docs Hugo Clarity Theme docs. Please note that the features listed under each theme are independent of each other. That is to say, some features may only be found in one theme and not in both. Compose Theme Docs Clarity Theme Docs

item.title: Usage
item.description: Create config interface Generate concrete config class Use the generated config class
